name: McMenamins Old St. Francis School

reviews.title: Don't miss the soaking tub
reviews.text: Unique in a good way! Cleverly decorated rooms--don't hesitate to spend the extra money for the king with the tubs. The open air soaking tub is not only beautiful but very relaxing. Be prepared to go through the bar to get to it; plan ahead and tote your suit to the locker room. Friendly staff, clean rooms, could have used a couple more light fixtures to accomodate reading. Great location downtown, but consider that the street level rooms will have passers-by into the evening. The quirks of a converted Catholic school made it all the more charming--we'll stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in a King Room. It was a great room with a lot of character. I can say I have never stayed in a hotel like this before, and just for that point I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Great Character and a Fun Experience

likes.liked: — The wonderful character, cleanliness, and uniqueness.
likes.disliked: — Not designed with a woman's needs in mind; picky air-conditioner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff was always so friendly and helpful, even when I awoke at 3 in the morning with allergies. They tried to round up some medicine for me.
reviews.title: Nothing special for the price....

likes.liked: — the beautiful pool, cleanliness, great bathrooms & showers
likes.disliked: — "package" deals, food, price for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is just fun - especially if you like a good beer in a very inviting atmosphere. They also have great food, a theater, and a soaking pool right there on the property. The hotel is also in close walking distance to downtown Bend. The beds were really comfortable too (we like a firm bed).
reviews.title: Fun staying in a school turned into a hotel.

reviews.text: I do recommend that if you want to see a movie in their theater that you get there early. It was filled when we went and we weren't able to have that experience.
reviews.title: Not your typical hotel

likes.disliked: — would have liked a microwave or toaster in the kitchen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from an overnight stay at McMenamins Old St. Francis school - what a disappointment. I had chosen the hotel based on reviews from this site but found the experience nothing like we had hoped. To say they have over-paneled ever conceivable surface with cheap wood is an understatement (even the ceiling!). The room was tiny and had horrible lighting. Our room unfortunately faced the pub which was expectantly loud until late. We ate at the attached pub twice, but the service at breakfast was terrible. We had a simple order- coffee, tea and two cinnamon rolls. Twenty minutes later the waitress finally comes back out to tell us they were out of the rolls and would something else do? We asked twice for cream for the tea which never arrived. We finally had to go up to the hostess to pay our bill since it was taking far too long to get the waitress back to take the money.
reviews.title: Overpriced
Title: HyperIronic Vibe, odd service, Comfy beds, unique artwork
reviews.text: Overall, a very expensive and disappointing experience. Definitely would not recommend.

The hotel is a one-time Catholic school decorated by post-hippie capitalists in an attractive if somewhat disconcerting matter. Each room is unique in the way it combines decorative motifs (curly cues, faces) with photographs and paintings of nuns, school kids, priests, and the Holy Family. For example, I stayed in the king suite, a room with a large bathroom that had two showers and two deep bathtubs. The room was named "Altar Boys" and had quotes from former altar boys on the walls of the bathroom. It was a bit odd. In the hallways the pictures from the catholic past share space with old rock posters (usually with a slightly 70s style psychedelic flavor). All this in a place with lots of boozing and carousing.
reviews.title: Don't forget your bathing suit

likes.disliked: — High Speed Internet worked but could be slow to connect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a small house in the back with a bar that features cigars and whiskey. In this house they play nothing but the Grateful Dead. Here is more irony -- the band that celebrated a low-money lifestyle being background to cigars and whiskey, signs of high capitalism. But the lives of us Boomers are permeated by this kind of irony.
reviews.title: Stay at the Old St. Francis School- you won't regret it!

likes.disliked: — the lighting was a little dim--sorry I couldn't think of anything very major, b/c we loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The large bed was very comfortable. The room was huge and quiet. There were lots of towels, soap, bath salts, and shampoos. The towels were very fluffy, unlike the bathrobes which were rough and obviously overused. The couch was comfortable. The window looked out onto a small garden. The lighting in the room was low (hard to be a reader in this room). I called for room service and the cheeseburgers were delicious but arrived without napkins or condiments.
reviews.title: a fun place to stay

likes.liked: — fun to stay in an old school. Nice attention to detail. Loved the theatre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at McMenamins Old St. Francis School for a three days as part of our travels through the state of Oregon. I purposely choose this location because of it's character read about here and via their website. We had a great stay in the "Jim Crowell" room which was a spacious twin queen room, with oak paneling and a good size bath (tiled shower only) that felt like the old "gang" showers in middle and high school during the 70's. Good size table and chairs for lounging in the room also. I liked the uniqueness of this accomodation, style fits right in with the outdoor/earthy feel to Bend. Front counter had pastries/snacks (which were excellent) and water/drinks to purchase.
reviews.title: Summer Weekend in School

reviews.text: The numerous postive reviews that preceed mine are entirely correct. The place is varied in accomodation, the atmosphere is just fun...they did an outstanding job in preserving the school nature, made the history interesting all the while keeping with great up-to-date accomodations.
reviews.title: Fun overnight in Bend

reviews.text: The room was very clean (and service was excellent over our stay for cleanliness), plenty of storage space, large windows (yes, the room due to paneling, can be "dark" as noted in other reviews as opposed to stark white walls in modern hotels - but there is plenty of three-way lighting both in the room lamps and overheads). Overhead fans in room, and quality of beds, bath etc were comfortable and fine.
reviews.title: What a Concept!

likes.disliked: — nothing, actually the house was a little pricey

reviews.text: The hotel has great conviences on premises - turkish bath, movie theatre, pub (very decent pub food - serving break/lunch/dinner) with their own brewed beers (pretty good stuff too), seperate smoking bar, pools tables etc. It's eclectic - very fun. We were there on "Cruise'in weekend" (classic cars etc) and it was full - guest wise, but still very quiet - no noise between rooms.
reviews.title: A positively unique experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location to town is excellent - within a block of shops and restaurants, very safe area, parking on site and the staff was very nice. We walked everywhere and to the nearby park along the river - it's a very central location to downtown offerings. Bend itself is a great town and a beautiful area with lots of variety for outdoor adventures. Both within itself as well as the neighboring areas within miles. We really loved this part of Oregon.
reviews.title: great place to stay in downtown Bend

reviews.text: I did not stay in the hotel (we stayed at the Mill Inn which I highly recommend) but I had a drink at the bar and later ate dinner here with my wife.
reviews.title: Really neat place.
Great relaxing casual place
reviews.text: In general the McMenamins establishments are pretty neat. They have artists and designers do them all, and they're really fun. Check out their website.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beer they brew is good. I had several and was happy. They also make wine, but I haven't tried it. I did try their home made gin and was pleased as well. The food was okay. We got there very early for dinner and I suspect they could do better. I would try them at least once more before as I can't imagine that they would put so much effort into the rest of their business and then neglect the food. Give it a whirl.
reviews.title: Tasty Adult Beverages, anyone?
Very Classy
reviews.text: McMennamins is a great relaxing casual place where you can just hang out and enjoy yourself. They have a pub with dining on the sidewalk out front or in the courtyard or in a more secluded spot with outdoor fires. There is a great Turkish bath for soaking. They play two free movies and you can order food and beer while you watch. The hotel is in a nice location that is close to the very attractive city park. It is great to have an option than your standard hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the 'European Style' room (i.e. bathroom down the hall) and had a wonderful time. The movie theater as great and who knew you could make a beer float taste that good? While I am sure this would be a nice place with a family my only experience was with just my wife and me.
reviews.title: McMenamins knows how to do it with style

likes.liked: — Clean, close to town, well priced
likes.disliked: — Couldn't get a second nite! I would like more non-smoking pubs
